author: Ove
content: Copyright reasons means they simply wanted to keep the rights to produce and sell their own quality pictures from their performances. But I think many museums and historically interesting churches practises a more liberate view on this, when simply not allowing flash (this might also be due to possible damages, I guess). Without extra light, you're unlikely to produce high quality pictures in a circus, not from the seat anyway. But, who knows, the ISO12800 digitals might do the trick...
